sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Milk for babes. Drawn out of the breasts of both Testaments. Chiefly, for the spirituall nourishment of Boston babes in either England: but may be of like use for any children. By John Cotton, B.D. and teacher to the church of Boston in New-England. Cotton, John, 1584-1652.
[2], 13, [1] p.
Printed by J. Coe, for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at his shop, in Popes-head Alley, London : 1646.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill 9th.". Reproductions of the originals in the British Library (Thomason Tracts) and in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (Early English Books).
=======
Milk for babes. Drawn out of the breasts of both Testaments. Chiefly, for the spirituall nourishment of Boston babes in either England: but may be of like use for any children. By John Cotton, B.D. and teacher to the church of Boston in New-England. Cotton, John, 1584-1652.
[2], 13, [1] p.
Printed by J. Coe, for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at his shop, in Popes-head Alley, London : 1646.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill 9th.". Reproductions of the originals in the British Library (Thomason Tracts) and in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (Early English Books).
Henry Overton

his shop, in Popes-head Alley
